| Effectiveness | Are food safety culture activities designed to be measured or establish the status of the  current culture, and improvements assessed? | Food safety culture objectives set in Management Review (18 August 2022) includes:  Staff Retention/Low Turn Over  Investment in Training for Staff  Management involved in day-to-day activities.  Accountability for Product Safety Action non-compliance.  Evaluation of effectiveness evident from trending of completing NCA’s & questionnaires completed by staff. | 3 |  |  |  | |  | |  |  | |

| Quality and food safety objectives | Are clear objectives defined to maintain and improve the safety, legality and quality of products manufactured, in accordance with the product safety and quality policy? | Objectives (documented in 1.2.2/ Rev 15 dated 28 August 2022) are as follows: Safety Zero time lost injuries – achieved  Customer complaints < 2 WO/month - achieved  Scrap Rate – No product recall/withdrawal  BRC – Maintain AA Certification. Objectives reviewed at Management review meeting | 3 |  |  |  | |  | |  |  | |
| Clear targets or clear measures of success in place? | Targets of measure are clear and is presented at Management Review. | 3 |  |  |  | |  | |  |  | |

| Legislative requirements | Is there a documented procedure to ensure the company is informed of scientific and technical developments? Industry codes, relevant legislation in countries of manufacturing and usage? Changes to the BRC standard or protocol? Who is responsible? | The Commercial manager ensure updates of information and standard are reviewed to ensure the site remains updated. The company receives legal updates from relevant internet websites e.g. SA Government and FDA updates (www.fda.gov/food/). A key local flexible film supplier is used for updates on EU & FDA Regulations as appropriate. The main legal requirements include the Foodstuffs, Cosmetics and Disinfectant Act 54 of 1972 and relevant FDA requirements. Compliance with legislation was demonstrated by a Legal Register (Doc Ref. 1.2F1 Rev 6 Dated 24 August 2022) and DOC (declaration of compliance) contents (ref. 3.7F5). Product and technological updates are sourced through close collaboration with a key local supplier of flexible plastics. Foodstuffs and cosmetic act as well as BRC , position statement and logo use protocol review. Latest review 24 August 2022 for Latest position statement f for Packaging remains still P618 dated 5.3.2021. | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| Human and financial resources | Has the organization determined and provided the human and financial resources needed to implement the processes of the QMS and product safety programme? | Resource provision is evident throughout the facility in terms of purchasing new equipment contracting external assistance with internal audits etc. System is documented. Resources are reviewed during annual management review. Examples of resource provision (as not in most recent management review) examples include:   * Lighting * Leak detection equipment * Floor scales at the end of each machine * Operator recruited for new slitter | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| BRC Standard and external audits | Is an electronic or hard copy of the BRC standard available? | The company possesses a copy of the current version of the Standard. A genuine (electronic) copy of the current Standard was available during the audit. | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| Are recertification audits scheduled and confirmed within prescribed deadline? | The audit is scheduled for September as is planned took place within due dated for 2022. 2023 audit is scheduled as unannounced. | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| Did the most senior production or operations manager participate in opening and closing meeting of the Global Standard audit? Relevant department managers or their deputies available during the audit? | Yes, both M Schlachter and C Schlachter as actively involved in managing parts of the system and participating in the audit. | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| Are all corrective actions from previous BRC audit addressed? Is there a system to close out nonconformities from internal, second or third party audits based on root cause? | Findings from the previous audit have been addressed and closed out effectively to prevent recurrence.  Finding 1/ Clause Ques# 2.2.6: Condition monitoring of existing roller already in place - 947814, 957422.  Finding 2/ Clause Ques# 3.3.1: Update the Record keeping procedure to provide a suitable time frame for filing and collation of completed records to ensure they are readily retrievable. Training of relevant staff to ensure adherence to updated procedure.  Finding 3/ Clause Ques# 3.5.4: Updated the Internal Audits procedure to include the requirement for documentation of root cause analysis when determining corrective actions for the audit findings. Updated the Internal Audit Report Templates to include a column for documentation of root cause analysis for each audit finding.  Finding 4/ Clause Ques# 3.12.1: Complaints register updated – 937201, NC 4 - Proof of investigation and closeout - 902633, 917827, 942455. Updated Internal audit Checklist – 9357. | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| Organisational structure, responsibilities and management authority | Is there a detailed, up-to-date organizational structure chart? | A documented company organogram is in place (ref. 1.3.1 dated 28 June 2022. The management structure, with designated deputies, is documented.  All personnel ultimately report to the Director. The management team comprises members representing Operation, Technical, Commercial Administration and Systems Coordination function. Senior management are present during the day-only production shift. The organisation chart indicates deputies for key positions. Communication channels are demonstrated on the organisation chart. Regular production communication involving the management team are is evident. Responsibilities and authorities for the designated manager and deputy are demonstrated in appointment letters which describe all the required activities. Responsibilities are defined on A RACI Matrix (Ref 1.3F1 Rev 10 dated 1.9.2022). Work instructions, in electronic and hard-copy, form part of the quality manual and are available on the factory floor as required. | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| Is there a designated competent manager and deputy within the management team who are responsible for coordinating compliance to the Standard? | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| Are documented, clearly defined responsibilities in place and communicated to key staff with responsibility for product safety legality, regulatory compliance and quality? | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| Stand-in policy in place to cover for the absence of key staff? | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| Clear communication and reporting channels in place to report on and monitor compliance with the Standard? | Communication channels are documented on the Organogram place (ref. 1.3.1 Revision 36 dated 28 June 2022.) | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| Are Job descriptions in place for those members of staff involved with activities relating to product safety, legality, regulatory compliance and quality? | Job descriptions are available for all managers and supervisors. Those reviewed (and found satisfactory) included job descriptions for Commercial manager (1.3F9, 23.8.2021), the Systems Coordinator (1.3F12 dated 26.8.2021). | 3 |  |  |  |  | | |  |  | |
| Management Review | Are management review meetings attended by the senior management team? Are they undertaken at planned intervals, at least annually? | Procedure (1.2) documents frequency as annually unless triggered.  Included all items in clause as well as objectives and performance against standard. Meeting agenda/minute template. Include outputs in minutes - Objective reviewed, actions, dates, responsibilities, area for signed off.  Some of the outputs documented in recent meeting include:   * Continuous monitoring of closing customer complaints * Investment in lead detection equipment * Refresher training for waste management and process control. * IA close outs to be actioned in a timeous manner   The site’s senior management undertook an annual management review which confirms the effectiveness of the product safety and quality management system. The review, chaired by the Managing Director, was conducted on 18 August 2022 and was attended by the management.  The annual review was conducted using a standard agenda which ensures that all prescribed inputs are considered. Key matters reviewed during and/or outputs from the most recent review included: The following key matters were considered during the review: review of internal audit nonconformities and customer complaints). No product recalls or withdrawals occurred in the last twelve months; security and food fraud control effectiveness review was done and documented.  The requirements for certification and declaration of the legal status of raw materials was reviewed as part of ongoing supplier assessment where Declarations of Compliance and migration analysis information was received and updated. Objectives are established and also reviewed during the review. | 3 |  |  |  | | |  |  |  | |
| Are there documented minutes of the management review and any action plans? | 3 |  |  |  | | |  |  |  | |
| Is there evidence to show that management reviews includes evaluation of:   * Previous management review   Documents, action plans and timeframes   * Results of Internal, second and third-party audits * Customer performance   indicators, complaints and  feedback   * Review of the hazard and risk management system * Incidents, corrective actions, out-of-specification results and non-conforming materials * Resource requirements * The site’s performance against the Standard and the objectives set * The effectiveness of the root cause analysis and corrective actions | 3 |  |  |  | | |  |  |  | |
